myapp.dbhandler

Class DBH

  • java.lang.Object
    • myapp.dbhandler.DBH

  • public class DBH
extends java.lang.Object
    DBH is the systems DataBaseHandler. This means that every insert, delete, update or select query to the DB goes through this object. This is to ensure opening and closing all connections to the DB is done correctly. We also accomplish a tidy way of doing DB management.
    Author:
    Fredrik Mediaa, Martin Moan

      Constructor and Description

      • getAllBikesOA

        public Bike[] getAllBikesOA()
        getAllBikesOA is a helper method for the original getAllBikes. This method just converts the ArrayList of Bike into a normal array
        Returns:
        returns a normal Bike[] array of all bikes

      • getAllBikes

        public java.util.ArrayList<Bike> getAllBikes()
        getAllBikes is the original method and is to be used when looking for all bikes registered in the database. It takes care of gathering all repairs belonging to every specific bike and pairing them together. It also takes care of the location for each bike. Docked bikes will get location from Docking station, while bikes out and about will have the latest logged location.

        Because of GUI mainly use ArrayLists I decided to return this.

        Returns:
        returns an ArrayList of the object Bike
        See Also:
        Bike, ArrayList, Repair

        public Bike getBikeByID(int bikeToFind)
        getBikeByID finds a bike and returns it based on the ID passed in.
        Parameters:
        bikeToFind - the bike that should be found in the database.
        Returns:
        the bike in its full detail updated by the database.
        See Also:
        Bike

        public Bike getBikeByID(Bike bike)

        Parameters:
        bike - the Bike object wanted to be found in the database.
        Returns:
        returns the bike with new details updated from database.

      • deleteBike

        public boolean deleteBike(int id)
        deleteBike use the softDelete status int Bike.DELETE to update the bike of the specific ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the bike which should be soft deleted.
        Returns:
        boolean based on the result from the query. True = OK, False = something went wrong.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        boolean based on the result from the query. True = OK, False = something went wrong.

      • logBikes

        public Bike[] logBikes(Bike[] bikes)
        logBikes takes in a Bike array and loops through creating sql insert queries for each one. Bike objects failed to insert will be returned in a Bike array.
        Parameters:
        bikes - a Bike object array with all bikes containing the information to be logged
        Returns:
        a Bike object array of failed bikes.
        See Also:
        Bike

        public boolean addBikeType(java.lang.String desc)
        addBikeType inserts a new type of bike to the bikeTypes table enabling users to use the new type
        Parameters:
        desc - String object with the name of the wanted type
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the result, True = added, False = not added

      • registerDocking

        public int registerDocking(Docking dock)
        registerDocking takes in a Docking object which then will be turned into an sql query. This method returnes the PrimaryKey of the insert statement.
        Parameters:
        dock - the Docking object whichs is to be inserted into the database
        Returns:
        PrimaryKey of the insert. Positive number means success, -1 means something went wrong.
        See Also:
        Docking

        Returns:

        See Also:

      • updateBikesInDockingStation

        public Bike[] updateBikesInDockingStation(int dockID)
        updateBikesInDockingStation takes in the ID and finds all bikes belonging to the station and returns them as a Bike object array.
        Parameters:
        dockID - the ID of a docking station.
        Returns:
        a Bike object array belonging to the docking station with the ID passed in.
        See Also:
        Bike, ArrayList

      • getDockingStationByName

        public Docking getDockingStationByName(java.lang.String name)
        getDockingStationByName takes a String object with the name of the docking station to be found. If found the Docking object will be created and returned.

        Bike object array is not added and has to be added manually with updateBikesInDockingStation()

        Parameters:
        name - String object of the name belonging to the station.
        Returns:
        Docking object with all information belonging to the station. NOT BIKES
        See Also:
        Docking

      • rentBike

        public boolean rentBike(User userRentingBike,
                        Bike bikeToRent,
                        int dockID)
        rentBike is the method to be called by a Docking object to take care of all the required actions needed when renting a bike
        Parameters:
        userRentingBike - the User object that is renting the bike
        bikeToRent - the bike that the User object want to rent
        dockID - the ID of the docking station where the bike is docked
        Returns:
        boolean based on the SQL query results. True = OK, False = something went wrong
        See Also:
        User, Bike, Docking

      • endRent

        public boolean endRent(Bike bike,
                       int dockID,
                       int spot)
        endRent is the opposite of rentBike. This method is to be used from a Docking object when a bike wants to dock to it.
        Parameters:
        bike - the Bike object to be docked
        dockID - the ID of the docking station where the bike is to be docked
        spot - the spot where the bike is to be docked on the station.
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the result from the SQL query. True = OK, False = something went wrong.
        See Also:
        Bike, Docking

      • dockBike

        public boolean dockBike(Bike bike,
                        int dockID,
                        int spot)
        dockBike is the opposite of undockBike() and is to be used by endRent(). This method takes care of the docking section of the SQL queries.
        Parameters:
        bike - the Bike object to be docked
        dockID - the ID of the docking station where the bike is to be docked.
        spot - the spot where the Bike object is to be docked at the docking station.
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the results of the SQL query. True = OK, False = something went wrong
        See Also:
        Bike

        ingStationsWithBikes returns a Docking object array containing all information about the stations and a Bike object array where Bike objects are put in their right spot.
        Returns:
        a Docking object array with everything there is to find.
        See Also:
        Docking, Bike

        Parameters:
        dock - the Docking object to be soft deleted the database
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the results from the SQL query. True = OK, False = something went wrong

      • checkIfUserExist

        public boolean checkIfUserExist(java.lang.String mail)
        checkIfUserExist is a method to check if there already is an entry in the database with the same emailaddress
        Parameters:
        mail - the email to be checked
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the results. True = Exist, False = Does not exist.

      • registerUser

        public int registerUser(User user,
                        boolean sendMail)
        registerUser lets you register a User objects data to the database if the email address does not exist.
        Parameters:
        user - the User object to be registered
        sendMail - a boolean that decides if an mail is sent to the user when created or not. True = Send, False = Do not send
        Returns:
        PrimaryKey of the entry also known as the users ID. -1 if something went wrong.
        See Also:
        User

      • loginUser

        public User loginUser(java.lang.String email,
                      java.lang.String password)
        loginUser is a method to check if the parameters match the information in the database. If it matches all details will be turned into a User object and returned
        Parameters:
        email - the mail address identifying the user
        password - the String of characters to be matched with database entry.
        Returns:
        User object with the information about the user that has logged in successfully. null object if information did not match.
        See Also:
        User

      • updateUser

        public boolean updateUser(User user)
        updateUser is a method for updating all the information about a User object in the database
        Parameters:
        user - The user to be updated
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the results from the database. True = updated, False = not updated.

      • changePassword

        public boolean changePassword(User user,
                              java.lang.String newPassword,
                              java.lang.String oldPassword)
        changePassword checks if the password in the database is equal to the password passed in. If so the old password would be updated with the new password.
        Parameters:
        user - the User object which is changing password
        newPassword - the new password that is supposed to be updated
        oldPassword - the old password to check validity of the user.
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the results. True = Password changed, False = Password did not change.
        See Also:
        User

      • forceChangePassword

        public boolean forceChangePassword(User user,
                                   java.lang.String newPassword)
        forceChangePassword is an optional method for changing the User objects password in the database. This method does not require the old password and will update the new password.
        Parameters:
        user - the User object to be updated
        newPassword - the password which is to be the new password
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the results. True = Password changed, False = Password did not change.
        See Also:
        User

      • deleteUser

        public boolean deleteUser(User user)
        deleteUser soft deletes the user in the database. That means status is set to User.SOFTDELETE
        Parameters:
        user - the User object to be soft deleted in the database
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the results. True = soft deleted, False = No change in status
        See Also:
        User

      • forgottenPassword

        public boolean forgottenPassword(java.lang.String mail)
        forgottenPassword is a method for reseting a users password. This password will be automatically generated and updated.
        Parameters:
        mail - the mail of the user where tue password is to be reset
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the result. True = Password changed, False = Something went wrong

      • getAllCustomers

        public User[] getAllCustomers()
        getAllCustomers gives you all users in the database with status equal to User.CUSTOMER
        Returns:
        an User object array

        public User[] getAllAdminUsers()
        getAllAdminUsers gives you all users in the database with status equal to User.ADMINISTRATOR
        Returns:
        an User object array

        public User[] getAllRepairUsers()
        getAllRepairUsers gives you all users in the database with status equal to User.REPAIRMAN
        Returns:
        an User object array

      • getAllRepairs

        public Repair[] getAllRepairs()
        getAllRepairs uses the getRepairsByID passing in 0 giving you the Repair objects of every bike
        Returns:
        Repair object array containing every repair registered in the database
        See Also:
        Repair

      • getAllRepairsForBike

        public Repair[] getAllRepairsForBike(int bikeID)
        getAllRepairsForBike uses the getRepairsByID to find Repair objects belonging to the bike ID given
        Parameters:
        bikeID - the bike ID to search for
        Returns:
        Repair object array with Repair objects belonging to the specific bike
        See Also:
        Repair

      • registerRepairRequest

        public boolean registerRepairRequest(int bikeID,
                                     java.lang.String desc,
                                     java.time.LocalDate date)
        registerRepairRequest are to be use by the Repair objects for registration in database. It takes care of registering the repair in the database and updating the status of the bike to Bike.REPAIR
        Parameters:
        bikeID - the bike ID which the Repair object belongs to
        desc - a String description of the problem which needs to be fixed
        date - the date of the registration.
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the results. True = Repair registered, False = Repair not registered
        See Also:
        Repair, LocalDate

      • finishRepairRequest

        public boolean finishRepairRequest(int caseID,
                                   java.lang.String desc,
                                   java.time.LocalDate date,
                                   double price)
        finishRepairRequest is a method for finishing a repair request already submitted.
        Parameters:
        caseID - the case number of the Repair object
        desc - the description of the finished job
        date - the date of the finished job
        price - the total price for the finished job
        Returns:
        a boolean based on the result. True = finished a request, False = something went wrong.
        See Also:
        LocalDate

      • removeAllUnfinishedTrips

        public void removeAllUnfinishedTrips()
        removeAllUnfinishedTrips is a powerful and dangerous method. This should not be used without caution.

        This method removes every unfinished entries in the trips table in the database. It also docks bikes that haven't managed to be docked with the simulation. Since this removes all unfinished trips you have to be sure EVERY BIKE NOT FINISHED ACTUALLY HAS COME FROM A CRASHING SIMULATION!

        See Also:
        BikeSlotPair, Bike, JOptionPane
